metadata.subject: BAMS
metadata.subject_title: Courses offered by Fac of BA

courses.subject: BAMS
courses.title: Business Field Study
courses.description: This course consists of preparatory assignments in readings and a written study plan, followed by a five to seven-day residential programme in a selected country or economy outside of Hong Kong and concluded with a written report and oral presentation. The residential programme will include site visits to state enterprises, joint ventures and manufacturing facilities as well as lectures, seminars and discussions with local and international company executives. The goal in taking learning sessions abroad is for Master’s students to expose to a wide spectrum of issues related to business operations, management and innovation in different nations and/ or regions. Through discussions with local government officials, managers and academics, trade, economics, finance, market, ventures, management practices, technologies, as well as geopolitics and social issues are highlighted.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in Master of Accountancy; MBA; MSc in Business Analytics; MSc in Finance; MSc in Information and Technology Management; MSc in Management; MSc in Marketing; MSc in Real Estate; or MSc in Sustainable Global Business
courses.learning_outcomes: Upon completion of the course, students will gain a basic understanding of the current business practices and related issues in the visiting country, economic regions, unions or association of nations.
courses.course_syllabus:
(1) Economic, political and cultural environment of the visiting country/ region

(2) General business environment in the visiting country/ region

(3) Business opportunities and challenges of local business

(4) Local business practices
courses.feedback_evaluation: Mandatory Course and Teaching Evaluation (CTE) is conducted at the end of the course.
courses.required_readings: To be assigned by course teacher
courses.recommended_readings: To be assigned by course teacher

courses.subject: BAMS
courses.title: Selected Topics in Business and Management
courses.description: This course is designed to provide students an opportunity to study the most current competitive business environment and relevant management methods.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in Master of Accountancy; MBA; MSc in Management; MSc in Marketing; or MSc in Sustainable Global Business
courses.learning_outcomes:
On completion of the course, students will:

• Learn current business developments and practices in the competitive environment.

• Gain deeper insights about contemporary management methods and practices to meet management challenges in a complex business environment.
courses.course_syllabus: To be formulated by course teacher
courses.feedback_evaluation: Mandatory Course and Teaching Evaluation (CTE) is conducted at the end of the course.
courses.required_readings: To be assigned by course teacher
courses.recommended_readings: To be assigned by course teacher
